column1: My well wishes are with @realDonaldTrump and @FLOTUS. Praying they recover from COVID-19 swiftly and fully. Our nation stands with them! https://t.co/fPlNyaHgCV

It was great to connect virtually with the @UpstateChamber Coalition this morning. We discussed a wide range of issues including COVID-19 rural broadband nuclear energy and supporting businesses during this time. Enjoyed catching up with everyone! #SC03 https://t.co/owKJItOZqP

To address this issue DHEC is expanding COVID-19 testing in Anderson County along with Pickens Oconee and Laurens Counties. The four new sites will be at the four county health departments. #SC03  https://t.co/EP5c59aJFs

The greatest country in the history of the world should have a better process for conducting legislative work than this. This COVID voting system is complete garbage. Show up. Do your darn job. And lets actually vote on stuff that matters and do it in a reasonable amount of time. https://t.co/DkiE9kjycd
This week the House conducted a series of votes that under normal rules would have took just 27 minutes to complete. Because of these silly COVID voting rules it took over 7 hours.

Are you a small business owner? Does your business need relief from COVID-19? There is still money available in the #PaycheckProtectionProgram (PPP) fund! The Small Business Administration is accepting new applications for the PPP through August 8 2020.   https://t.co/Qq7ZlEUvkR https://t.co/Keonbx3Kfe

Today @HouseCommerce is having a full committee hearing on “Oversight of the Trump Administration’s Response to the COVID-19 Pandemic.” I’ll have the opportunity to question top health officials from the Trump Administration. Tune in now  - https://t.co/leY8zxVQGX

“Retail sales shattered already-lofty expectations for May as consumers freed from the coronavirus-induced lockdowns began shopping again.”  Our economy is on the road to recovery! Let’s keep reopening America!! 🇺🇸  https://t.co/8ZRk8ggYzO
Thinking of @RepTomRice & his family and praying they recover from COVID-19 as soon as possible. Glad to hear you’re on the mend my friend and hope to see you soon.

FYI South Carolinians voting in the primary tomorrow – the State is facing a shortage of poll workers due to COVID-19 and therefore over 100 polling locations have been moved or consolidated. Please visit the link below to verify your precinct location! https://t.co/eW4KQGbspC

My SC colleagues & I sent a bipartisan letter to House & Senate leadership urging them to expand broadband access in rural communities. This is an issue I’ve long been behind & the COVID-19 pandemic has added a sense of urgency for Congress to get it done! https://t.co/pXQYg5AaEk
453560 COVID-19 tests were conducted in the United States yesterday a new single-day high for testing!

The House passed the Paycheck Protection Program Flexibility Act today! I proudly supported this legislation & am confident it will create an easier road to recovery for small businesses suffering from COVID-19. #PPP #SupportSmallBiz
Been keeping this page on my website constantly updated with important COVID19 information. I hope you'll find it useful! https://t.co/T3YiY6fY6M

Attn: Farmers & Ranchers – @USDA launched the application for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) today. The CFAP will provide direct relief to farmers & ranchers that have been negatively impacted by COVID-19. For more information - visit https://t.co/RCkILkv5bj

@USDA launched the application for the Coronavirus Food Assistance Program (CFAP) today. The CFAP will provide direct relief to farmers and ranchers that have been negatively impacted by COVID-19. For more information and to view the application - visit https://t.co/ZK9CL1M3L5

It’s #NationalEMSWeek! Thank you to all our #EMS providers for going beyond the call of service especially during the COVID-19 pandemic. Your hard work on the front lines makes our communities safer and we honor you!
Like the saying goes… “never let a good crisis go to waste.” That’s been Nancy Pelosi’s disgraceful theme during the entire COVID-19 outbreak. https://t.co/2jHMoC5Xbg

The Working Under Humanity’s Actual Needs (WUHAN) Rescissions Act would claw back $27B in CARES Act spending that is unrelated to #COVID19. We need to fight against wasteful spending & responsibly legislate the issue at hand. The crisis shouldn’t be used to advance pet projects! https://t.co/pnKbACRbLB

While many of these programs are not the role of government & shouldn’t receive any funding some of these programs merit consideration. However that consideration should be done in a different bill instead of #COVID19 rescue & recovery legislation.

The American people expect their elected officials to seriously debate & legislate the issue at hand – especially during a crisis – instead of utilizing an emergency to bolster unrelated initiatives. #COVID19
Introduced the Working Under Humanity’s Actual Needs (WUHAN) Rescissions Act to eliminate over $27 billion in spending included in the CARES Act unrelated to #COVID19. https://t.co/gK0y5WY8ka

America is hurting right now but America is resilient & will overcome any challenge. We will get through this as a nation & come out stronger than ever. Keep those impacted by the #coronavirus in your prayers as we all do our part to combat this economic & public health threat!
